REST API main¶

REST API database.db¶

REST API database.models¶

class src.database.models.Contact(**kwargs)¶

Bases: Base

Represents a contact entity in the database.

Attributes:

id (int): The unique identifier for the contact. first_name (str): The first name of the contact. last_name (str): The last name of the contact. email (str): The email address of the contact. phone_number (str): The phone number of the contact. birthday (datetime): The birthday of the contact. additional_data (str): Additional information about the contact. hashed_password (str): The hashed password for the contact.

additional_data¶
birthday¶
email¶
first_name¶
hashed_password¶
id¶
last_name¶
phone_number¶

REST API schemas.contact¶

class src.schemas.contact.Contact(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, phone_number: str, birthday: datetime, additional_data: str = None, id: int)¶

Bases: ContactBase

Pydantic model for displaying contact details.

Inherits from ContactBase and includes an additional ‘id’ field.

Parameters:

id – The unique identifier for the contact.

class Config¶

Bases: object

class src.schemas.contact.ContactBase(*, first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, phone_number: str, birthday: datetime, additional_data: str = None)¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base Pydantic model for contact data.

Parameters:

  • first_name – The first name of the contact.

  • last_name – The last name of the contact.

  • email – The email of the contact.

  • phone_number – The phone number of the contact.

  • birthday – The birthday of the contact.

  • additional_data – Additional data for the contact (optional).

username: str | None¶
src.schemas.token.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None)¶

Create a JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • data – Data to encode in the JWT token.

  • expires_delta – The timedelta by which the token will expire. If None, defaults to 15 minutes.

Returns:

Encoded JWT token as a string.

src.schemas.token.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))¶

Retrieve the current user from the token.

Parameters:

token – The JWT token.

Returns:

TokenData with the username, if successful.

Raises:

HTTPException – If token validation fails.

REST API utils.email¶

REST API utils.rate_limiting¶

async src.utils.rate_limiting.rate_limit(request: Request, max_requests: int, interval_seconds: int)¶

Limits the number of requests that can be made in a given time interval.

Parameters:

  • request – The incoming HTTP request.

  • max_requests – Maximum number of allowed requests in the interval.

  • interval_seconds – The time interval in seconds.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the rate limit is exceeded.

REST API utils.token¶

src.utils.token.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta = None)¶

Create an access token.

Parameters:

  • data – The payload data to be encoded in the token.

  • expires_delta – Optional expiration time delta for the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

src.utils.token.decode_token(token: str)¶

Decode a JWT token.

Parameters:

token – The JWT token to be decoded.

Returns:

The decoded payload of the token.

Raises:

JWTError – If the token cannot be validated or decoded.

REST API utils.utils¶

src.utils.utils.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None)¶

Create an access token.

Parameters:

  • data – The payload data to be encoded in the token.

  • expires_delta – Optional expiration time delta for the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

src.utils.utils.decode_access_token(token: str)¶

Decode an access token.

Parameters:

token – The JWT token to be decoded.

Returns:

The decoded payload of the token or None if token is invalid.

src.utils.utils.generate_reset_token(email: str)¶

Generate a password reset token.

Parameters:

email – Email for which the reset token is being generated.

Returns:

JWT token for password reset.

src.utils.utils.get_password_hash(password)¶

Hash a password.

Parameters:

password – The plain text password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

src.utils.utils.verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify a password against a hashed version.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password – The hashed password.

Returns:

Boolean indicating if the password is correct.

src.utils.utils.verify_reset_token(token: str)¶

Verify a password reset token.

Parameters:

token – The JWT token to be verified.

Returns:

The email associated with the token if valid, None otherwise.
